refnamediv.refpurpose: ELF analyzer to identify missing static modifiers

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: missingstatic is a script that analyses ELF object files to identify symbols that are unused outside their compilation unit. Those symbols are usually candidate for the static modifier, to make the symbol local to the unit.

In addition to symbols that are used only internally to an unit, this script will most likely report the almost entire set of externally-visible API in the case of libraries. For this reason, options are provided to reduce the scope of action.

listitem.para: Only show symbols that have hidden visibility. Hidden symbols are not visible from outside the module, and thus will ignore the external visible symbols that compose the externally-visible API. This option is only useful for libraries that make proper use of visibility attributes.

Show the type of the symbol. The symbols reported by the script might be functions, variables, or constants. By default, only the name of the symbol, with this option, a letter in front of the symbol will tell you the type of it; the letters are the same as used by GNU nm1:
T
The symbol is in the text (code) section, and is thus a function
B
The symbol is in the uninitialised data section (known as BSS), and is thus a variable.
D
The symbol is in the initialised data section, and is thus a variable.
R
The symbol is in the read only data section, and is thus a constant.

Ignore symbols whose name triggers the given regular expression. This option is useful to hide all the symbols of the public API of a library if they all have the same prefix. It can be used multiple times.

Ignore symbols present in a tags file created by exuberant-ctags. This option is useful to hide all the symbols in the public header files of a project, by creating a list of public-visible symbols. See the EXAMPLES section for how to generate such a tags file. It can be used multiple times.

refsect2.title: Sorting missingstatic output
refsect2.para:
Sine sorting by translation unit is non-trivial inside the script, piping through
sort 1
is suggested. Using the -k option it's possible to sort for the desired key, may it be the symbol name, the translation unit name or the symbol type.

example.title: Sorting missingstatic output for translation unit name

refsect1.title: Bugs and Missing Features
refsect1.para: missingstatic assumes that all the sources for a module and just that module will be passed to it, if more or less sources will be passed to the command, the results might not be the expected ones.
